seo_keywords: Bissell Little Green leaking from bottom

problems.title: Leaking from Bottom
problems.description: Water pools underneath the unit while running or sitting.
possible_causes: Dirty water tank seal is missing or damaged
Clean water tank cap is loose
solution_steps: Check the black rubber gasket on the dirty water tank bottom.
Tighten the cap on the clean water tank.
If leaking from the vent, the dirty tank is too full. Empty it.

problems.title: Hose Cracked / No Suction
problems.description: The flexible hose has a tear or the suction is very weak at the tool end.
possible_causes: Hose wear and tear (common after 2 years)
solution_steps: Inspect the hose for splits. Duct tape is a temporary fix.
Remove the tool and rinse it under a faucet to clear hair.
If the hose is ripped, the entire hose assembly must be replaced (requires disassembly).

faqs.question: Is it worth fixing the issue on a Little Green Portable Cleaner (1400B)?
faqs.answer: Yes. A replacement part typically costs significantly less than a new $493 vacuum, and extending the life of your Bissell is eco-friendly.

faqs.question: How do I know if my Little Green Portable Cleaner (1400B) needs a new part?
faqs.answer: Common signs include strange noises and the device failing to complete a cleaning cycle.

faqs.question: Can I replace the part on my Little Green Portable Cleaner (1400B) myself?
faqs.answer: Yes, this is a user-serviceable repair. Most replacements generally require just a screwdriver and about 10-20 minutes of time.
